title: Cognizant hiring: CEO says Arts graduates wanted not CS; here's his reason why
description: Cognizant CEO Ravi Kumar S announces the IT firm is hiring more school graduates than ever in 2025, actively recruiting liberal arts majors from community colleges alongside traditional STEM candidates. Kumar tells Fortune that AI creates entry-level opportunities by amplifying human potential rather than displacing workers. He advises students to focus on interdisciplinary skills, combining fields like history with computational abilities. The CEO emphasizes that as AI makes expertise accessible, applying intelligence becomes more valuable than specialisation, with faster paths to expertise for graduates who leverage AI tools effectively.

title: Singapore hospital: Indian nurse jailed over 1 year for molesting male visitor

The 34-year-old nurse, Elipe Siva Nagu, claimed he intended to 'disinfect' the victim. The incident, which occurred in June, caused the victim significant emotional distress.

Investigations are ongoing following the registration of a case.

Are rocks alive? Truth about egg-laying rocks of China’s Guizhou province
description: In China's Guizhou province, smooth oval stones emerge from cliff faces, a geological phenomenon locals call "egg stones." Scientifically known as concretions, these form over millions of years as minerals cement within softer rock, eventually being exposed by erosion. This natural process, occurring every few decades, has inspired generations of folklore and continues to draw tourists.

title: Chennai on high watch: Cyclone 'Montha' looms; IMD issue orange alert
description: Chennai and neighboring districts are bracing for heavy rainfall as the season's first cyclonic storm, potentially named Montha, takes shape over the Bay of Bengal. The IMD has issued an orange alert for October 27, forecasting significant downpours.

title: Lakshya, Diksha, Shaina in quarterfinals of Badminton Asia U-17 and U-15 Championships
description: The sixth seed Diksha showed her composure while outclassing Chinese Taipei's Pin Hsuan Chiang 21-19 21-15 to secure a last-eight berth in the U-17 segment

title: It was a mistake to join hands with RJD: Nitish
description: The JD(U) president addressed a rally in Samastipur district, from where the Prime Minister launched his campaign for the high-stakes elections

title: Ayesha Curry stuns fans with custom Warriors gift amid divorce rumors
description: Stephen Curry kicked off the NBA season with a stellar performance, leading the Warriors to victory. Meanwhile, his wife Ayesha received a unique, custom-designed Warriors jersey from Kristin Juszczyk. Ayesha's social media posts, including one referencing "Year 17," sparked fan confusion, while recent divorce rumors were debunked, with Ayesha clarifying her past views on marriage and motherhood.

title: Pregnant woman among other migrants languish in Bangladesh even after Calcutta High Court order; Trinamool points fingers at Centre
description: It has been four weeks since the Calcutta High Court directed authorities to bring back the six migrant workers who were pushed into Bangladesh months back

title: Super Cup kicks off in Goa, hopes to revive flagging Indian football
description: Traditionally held at the end of the season in Bhubaneswar, the Super Cup has been moved to Goa this time as a season opener to provide ISL clubs

title: Beena Philip may not contest in local body polls
description: Kozhikode Mayor says new generation should get a chance

title: Floodplains get flattened to construct Chhath ghats
description: Bulldozers, earthmovers employed to fell trees, lay roads, and carry out soil compaction across the Yamuna’s floodplains; action violates NGT orders, amounts to ecological destruction, say experts

title: MCD drive ‘illegal’, have commercial licences to operate in residential area: Chandni Chowk shop owners
description: Shop owners said they had “paid conversion charges” and received “necessary clearances” to run commercial units in residential premises.

title: Intel profitable again: How Trump's bet paid off; stock up 50%
description: Chip giant Intel has returned to profit after six quarters of losses. The company reported strong revenue in the third quarter, driven by high demand for its chips. This positive performance follows a significant investment from the US government. Intel expects this robust demand to continue through 2026. The company's client computing segment, which includes PC and laptop chips, saw a 5% year-over-year increase. Artificial intelligence is seen as a key driver for future growth.

title: Last Dance Down Under: India fret over bowling attack in Ro-Ko's Australian swansong
description: Whether Kohli, in particular, continues to play post Australia series is a matter of conjecture but the final ODI at the iconic SCG will be more than a mere "dead rubber"

title: Durgapur gang rape: Survivor identifies 5 accused; lawyer hails 'satisfactory results'
description: Durgapur gang rape survivor identified five accused during a Test Identification parade at the correctional home. The sixth accused, known to the survivor, was not part of the parade. The investigation is progressing well, with police focusing on the roles of those involved in the rape and subsequent extortion.

title: Ontario cracks down on truck driving license, makes one year Canadian experience mandatory
Tennessee explosives plant blast that killed 16 people was a chain reaction felt 20 miles away
'Breaking windows was our only way to escape:' Survivors recall Andhra bus tragedy
description: Tragedy struck on the Hyderabad-Bengaluru highway as a private bus caught fire, claiming 19 passengers and a biker. The inferno erupted after the bus rammed a motorcycle, dragging it for 300 meters. Trapped by a jammed exit and sealed windows, survivors bravely broke free. Authorities are expediting DNA profiling for victim identification.

Kevin Garnett caught in NBA gambling scandal as his name surfaces in probe
description: The FBI's investigation into illicit gambling and poker activities has intensified, leading to the arrest of NBA players Terry Rozier and former player Chauncey Billups. Hall of Famer Kevin Garnett is also reportedly linked to private poker games investigated by the FBI, though he has not been charged with any wrongdoing.

title: Chamari Athapaththu blames defeats to India, England for Women’s World Cup setback

Giannis Antetokounmpo probable to play vs Raptors despite toe sprain
description: Milwaukee Bucks' superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable for tonight's game against the Toronto Raptors, managing a left great toe sprain. Despite this, the team is optimistic about his availability, though his minutes may be managed. Guard Kevin Porter Jr. remains out with an ankle injury, impacting the Bucks' rotation. The Raptors expect a competitive lineup led by Scottie Barnes.

title: Pune horror: Woman strangles husband over domestic issue; arrested
description: A 29-year-old woman has been arrested in Pune for allegedly strangling her 40-year-old husband after a domestic dispute. The incident occurred early Friday morning following a heated argument. The wife, who was preparing to contest local elections, reportedly overpowered her husband and used a piece of cloth to strangle him. Their two young children were asleep during the altercation.

Why fans are posting ‘RIP Ted Nivison’ on X- check truth behind rumors
description: YouTuber Ted Nivison trended on X with fake RIP messages. This was due to an old joke from 2022 resurfacing. His friend JSchlatt posted a tribute, sparking a viral meme. Nivison himself played along, confirming it was an inside joke. Fans reacted with humor and some concern over the spread of misinformation.

description: One of the towering figures of Indian advertising, Piyush Pandey, passed away on October 24 at the age of 70.

title: Watch: George Orwell’s birthplace left to decay in Bihar
description: George Orwell’s birthplace in Motihari, Bihar, continues to fall into neglect despite being declared a protected site in 2010. Broken windows, sagging roofs, and minimal maintenance highlight stalled restoration, while debates over promoting the legacy of the British writer fuel local controversy. Admirers and literary enthusiasts remain concerned about preserving the author’s historic home.

Watch: Why AIR banned Ilayaraja’s ‘Oram Po’ song and how J. Jayalalithaa opposed the ban
description:
In 1979, former Chief Minister J. Jayalalithaa, then known only as an actor, launched a scathing critique of Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini for his decision to ban all music from the country’s radio and television. 
Her critique began with a local issue: the decision of All India Radio (AIR) to ban the song Oram Po, Oram Po Rukumani Vandi Varuthu from the 1979 Tamil film Ponnu Oorukku Pudusu.

Tax saving drives private bus operators to use out-of-State vehicles
description: Telangana has less than 100 private long-distance buses, buses registered in other parts of the country are used to plying long-distance routes so as to save on the tax component; once an All-India Permit is available, operators can ply buses on all available routes, a senior transport officer said

title: Rozgar Mela brings job opportunities to 116 candidates in Chennai on Friday
description: In Tamil Nadu alone, nearly 334 candidates received offer letters in similar events organised by the Postal Department at Tiruchi, Coimbatore, and Madurai on Friday.

description: Former Microsoft CTO Nathan Myhrvold faces scrutiny over a disturbing birthday letter allegedly sent to Jeffrey Epstein, reportedly containing graphic images.  The letter, revealed in a congressional report, referenced Epstein as a "lifestyle advisor." Myhrvold, who previously flew on Epstein's jet, now calls their connection a "passing acquaintance" and expresses regret.

Indian-origin man Umesh Patel sentenced to home detention in New Zealand
description: An Indian-origin Auckland man, Umesh Patel, has been sentenced to nine months of home detention for orchestrating an elaborate immigration fraud scheme. Patel created fake jobs and submitted fraudulent documents to Immigration New Zealand, charging applicants between NZD $10,000 and $30,000. The scheme, which ran for years, undermined the integrity of New Zealand's immigration system.

title: Former US cop shot himself, blamed a Black man, and faked it all to win back ex-girlfriend
description: A former New York State trooper staged his own shooting to impress his ex-girlfriend. Thomas Mascia faked a traffic stop attack on October 30, 2024. He insisted on being taken to the hospital where his former partner worked. This deception led to his job loss, reputation damage, and a six-month jail sentence. He also faces a significant restitution payment.

title: Emman Atienza: How did the TikTok star, daughter of Kuya Kim Atienza die at 19
description: TikTok creator Emman Atienza, 19, daughter of TV host Kim Atienza, passed away by suicide in Los Angeles on October 22. Known for her honest discussions on self-love and mental health, her passing has deeply affected her family, friends, and thousands of young followers who found solace in her online presence.

title: OpenAI’s Airbnb ties: Brian Chesky to friend Sam Altman; can’t use ChatGPT right now
description: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky expressed interest in integrating OpenAI's ChatGPT, but found its current SDK insufficient for their needs. While Airbnb already uses AI, the trend favors customizable open-source models, with Chinese tech giants like Alibaba leading the charge by releasing advanced, cost-effective systems and fostering a vast open-source AI ecosystem.

title: Andre Agassi & Steffi Graf’s daughter Jaz introduces adorable new partner Copper
description: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf's daughter, Jaz, has introduced a new cocker spaniel puppy named Copper to the family, delighting fans. The legendary tennis couple's children are described as normal, with Jaz enjoying typical teenage outings and son Jaden pursuing baseball. Agassi emphasizes fatherhood as his most important role, cherishing his bond with his children.
